(Eh, I'm losing my mind in my old age.)

Ice::
She nodded to Lunarpine. "Ah yes, now I remember."  She guided the 
pod and tried to keep on the defencive.  She read Razor Claw's mind 
and smiled. She opened her mind to him. "Don't worry Razor Claw. With 
your strength and power, you won't need weapons."
She closed her mind and tried to concentrate on flying.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> The Pods the same as the one that Lunarpine and Shadow Wing had 
origionally
> taken across the sea when I first started playing.
> 
> Lunarpine set back in the pod. Travelling back and forth from there 
to
> Africa always made him nervous. "Remember, we're flying through 
Predacon
> airspace so remain quiet. None of us can fly and fight at the same 
time so
> we'll be moving at top speed through there."  He stared at Razor 
Claw, he
> didn't know how to handle the Predacon on thier side, he hoped that 
it
> wouldn't come down to a fight between them. Ice was the leader now 
so he had
> to accept it. She was now his superior. "Ready to lift off when you 
are
> boss."
> 
> Razor Claw wasn't to fond of having to go into a Maximal ship 
without any
> energy weapons. Veratis didn't believe in such things.
> 
> 
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <logomorph@h...>
> To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, November 29, 2000 8:12 AM
> Subject: (ALL MAXIMALS READ) Re: Why attack? / Maximal Meeting
> 
> 
> > Ice::
> >
> > She smiled as Lunarpine stroked her back. She still felt like she 
was
> > out of her league.  "Well, confidence isn't easily gained. But I 
will
> > do my best."  She turned and walked outside. She went to the pod 
and
> > walked in.  She had never flown one before. She looked at the
> > controls and sighed. "Anyone knw how to fly one of these things?" 
She
> > ahd never needed to fly a pod before. She had always had her own
> > wings to use to get around. She nervously sat down in the pilot 
seat
> > and looked at the controls, studying them.  "Well, let's try this
> > then." She grabbed the joystick in her hand and moved it forward.
> > nothing happened.  She pressed a few buttons on the console. 
nothing
> > happened.  She was starting to get frustrated. "DARN IT, START!"
> >
> > Her anger triggered her telekenetic powers to start up the engines
> > and start up the thruster. "Hey, now how did that happen? I wasn't
> > even trying."  She looked as the console lights flickered and
> > listened to the roar of the engines. "Wow."
> >
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > Lunarpine saw the worried look on her face. He followed her
> > outside, "He
> > > made the right decision, your abilities give you an advantage we
> > could never
> > > have." He knew that she'd never led before, but now she had an
> > edge. If
> > > she'd stop thinking like a recon bot. "I'll be at your side when
> > the time
> > > comes. I've got confidence in you." he smiled and pet het along 
her
> > back.
> > > She was no longer a typical recon bot she was now a prototype 
for
> > Veratis'
> > > new life. She is now stronger than she was, faster than she was,
> > and even
> > > more powerfull than she was. If she got her confidence up she'd 
be
> > able to
> > > lead as well as the rest.
> > >
> > > OOC did I tell you that Icebirds function happens to be mutant
> > commander?
> > >
> > > BIC Veratis radiod ahead to the compartment where the maximal
> > transport pod
> > > was kept." Razor Claw, Ice, and Lunarpine will be there 
shortly."
> > >
> > > Foxfingers tinkered with the control settings. He knew better 
than
> > to take
> > > chances of showing his face at the CF again without good reason.
> > He'd stolen
> > > from them and he was sure that they wouldn't be happy about it.
> > > He completed the preflight checklist and doublechecked the
> > coordinates, "All
> > > set, they can lift off whenever they're ready."
> > >
> > > Razor Claw was outfitted with a DNA collector. The device was a
> > probe
> > > extending from the hand, attached internally to a power supply 
box
> > equipped
> > > with transmitter, the information from anybody he touched would 
be
> > sent
> > > directly back to Veratis. The plan was brilliant.
